title: Lamentations 3:1
text: I AM the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

title: Lamentations 3:2
text: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

title: Lamentations 3:3
text: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.

title: Lamentations 3:4
text: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

title: Lamentations 3:5
text: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

title: Lamentations 3:6
text: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

title: Lamentations 3:7
text: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

title: Lamentations 3:8
text: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

title: Lamentations 3:9
text: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

title: Lamentations 3:10
text: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

title: Lamentations 3:11
text: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

title: Lamentations 3:12
text: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

title: Lamentations 3:13
text: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

title: Lamentations 3:14
text: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

title: Lamentations 3:15
text: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.

title: Lamentations 3:16
text: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

title: Lamentations 3:17
text: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.

title: Lamentations 3:18
text: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the LORD:

title: Lamentations 3:19
text: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

title: Lamentations 3:20
text: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

title: Lamentations 3:21
text: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.

title: Lamentations 3:22
text: It is of the LORD's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

title: Lamentations 3:23
text: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

title: Lamentations 3:24
text: The LORD is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

title: Lamentations 3:25
text: The LORD is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

title: Lamentations 3:26
text: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.

title: Lamentations 3:27
text: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

title: Lamentations 3:28
text: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.

title: Lamentations 3:29
text: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

title: Lamentations 3:30
text: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.

title: Lamentations 3:31
text: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

title: Lamentations 3:32
text: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

title: Lamentations 3:33
text: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

title: Lamentations 3:34
text: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

title: Lamentations 3:35
text: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

title: Lamentations 3:36
text: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

title: Lamentations 3:37
text: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

title: Lamentations 3:38
text: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?

title: Lamentations 3:39
text: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

title: Lamentations 3:40
text: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the LORD.

title: Lamentations 3:41
text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

title: Lamentations 3:42
text: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

title: Lamentations 3:43
text: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

title: Lamentations 3:44
text: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

title: Lamentations 3:45
text: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

title: Lamentations 3:46
text: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

title: Lamentations 3:47
text: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

title: Lamentations 3:48
text: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

title: Lamentations 3:49
text: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

title: Lamentations 3:50
text: Till the LORD look down, and behold from heaven.

title: Lamentations 3:51
text: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.

title: Lamentations 3:52
text: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

title: Lamentations 3:53
text: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.

title: Lamentations 3:54
text: Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.

title: Lamentations 3:55
text: I called upon thy name, O LORD, out of the low dungeon.

title: Lamentations 3:56
text: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

title: Lamentations 3:57
text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

title: Lamentations 3:58
text: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

title: Lamentations 3:59
text: O LORD, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

title: Lamentations 3:60
text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

title: Lamentations 3:61
text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;

title: Lamentations 3:62
text: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

title: Lamentations 3:63
text: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.

title: Lamentations 3:64
text: Render unto them a recompence, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.

title: Lamentations 3:65
text: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.

title: Lamentations 3:66
text: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.
